snippet: The idea that a college diploma is an all-but-mandatory ticket to a successful career is showing fissures. Risky? Perhaps. But it worked for the founders of Twitter, Tumblr and a little company known as Apple.
abstract: Growing number of ambitious young people, fearful of sagging job market and student loan debt, are dropping out of college to gain skills through online learning and real-life experience; many are inspired by groups like Uncollege, which advocates self-directed higher education, and by success stories of famous college drop-outs who founded Twitter, Tumblr and Apple.
lead_paragraph: The idea that a college diploma is an all-but-mandatory ticket to a successful career is showing fissures. Risky? Perhaps. But it worked for the founders of Twitter, Tumblr and a little company known as Apple.

headline.print_headline: The Old College Try? No Way
